reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Provision of equitable access to Emergency and lifesaving integrated health care services to vulnerable host communities, internally displaced population and returnees through fixed and mobile facilities in Dhusamareb Districts, Galgadud region.

description.narrative: This project is designed to deliver lifesaving emergency health services including maternal, neonatal and child health through a fixed and mobile health facility targeting women, men, girls and boys from IDP settlements and vulnerable host communities. The project will deliver lifesaving emergency health services including maternal, neonatal and child health through 2 static and 2 mobile health facilities to meet the needs of both host communities and IDPs that are recovering from the effects of persistent droughts and armed conflicts in the district of Dhusamareb in Galgadud region. .The health facilities of Dhusamareb and GuriEl supported by New ways with this project , will provide skilled deliveries, consultation and treatment of both under and over fives for common illnesses, immunization services, early detection and treatment of communicable diseases. The project will benefit 34,000 which include 16,320 women,10,880 men, 3,400 boys and 3,400 girls that include both vulnerable host communities and IDPs, who will benefit from services delivered by qualified and skilled health personnel that would provide antenatal, post natal and safe delivery to PLWs, as well as treatment of common illnesses promoting health seeking behavior. New ways mobile teams of this project will refer complicated and risky pregnancies to new ways fixed health facility which provides CEmOC services supported by UNFPA. The project is going to support the health facility of Dhusamareb where New ways already operate with various activities including ANC and PNC , IRT (HIV/AIDs program) with the support of UNICEF and Cemoc service supported by UNFPA though an MOU with FG MoH. This, lifesaving integrated, health project will strengthen the health service through support to the staff already operating in the sector as well as recruiting more staff for the health facility in Dhusamareb as well as extending the same support to starlin hospital in Guri El which is a referral hospital , where cesarean section is also performed, admitting complicated pregnancies which are regularly referred from the southern part of the district and beyond.

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
